short_summary: replace existing roof with new EPDM material. Work to be done in sections.
description: Roof structure is a steel beam with a 2:12 slope. 240 concrete blocks are placed on the roof to prevent damage from high winds. Concrete blocks will be removed and replaced in sections. New fiberboard will be installed underneath the new EPDM membrane. 75mm metal flashing will be installed and geotextile will be laid on the membrane. Work to be done near Port Aux Basques, Newfoundland and Labrador.
full_summary:
### Roof Repairs at Table Mountain VHF Site
#### Newfoundland and Labrador

**Notice ID:** cb-494-75733853

**Tender Title (English):** Roof Repairs - Table Mountain VHF Site

**Tender Title (French):** Réparation du toit au site VHF Table Mountain

**Publication Date:** 2024-05-08

**Tender Closing Date and Time:** 2024-05-31T14:00:00

**Location:** Route 480, Burgeo, Newfoundland and Labrador

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada department requires a contractor to perform roof repairs at the Table Mountain VHF radio site. The project involves replacing the existing roof membrane with a new EPDM membrane, installing a 170N geotextile layer, and reinforcing the roof eave.

**Work Scope:**

- Remove the existing torch-on membrane and fiberboard.
- Install new fiberboard as required.
- Build out the roof eave an additional 75mm all around the perimeter.
- Install 0.64mm pre-finished metal flashing.

**Location and Site Access:**

The worksite is located at Route 480, Burgeo, Newfoundland and Labrador, near Port-Aux-Basques. The site has become inaccessible to large equipment and heavy vehicles due to road conditions.

**Specifications and Drawings:**

The project's scope is specified in a general specification document with specific works identified on drawings. The contractor is responsible for determining the scope of work split between sub-contractors and trade jurisdictions.

**Notice Information:**

The notice is available in both English and French. The attachment file for this notice contains four addenda, an Invitation to Tender (ITT), and two specification documents (one in English, one in French).

**Contact Information:**

For more information, please contact Cal LaKing at DFO.Tenders-Soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca or (506) 478-3581.
